programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf
programme.desc: The final day of play at the KPMG Women's Irish Open on the Ladies European Tour. The world's number one amateur Lottie Woad carries a sizeable seven-shot lead heading into the final day.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 John Deere Classic, a PGA Tour event held at TPC Deere Run in Silvis, Illinois. The United States' Davis Thompson earned his first win here in 2024.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:Spurs/Chelsea 08
programme.desc: Relive a classic match from the Premier League. Here, Spurs and Chelsea go head-to-head at White Hart Lane in an end-to-end encounter that produced eight goals.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:Man Utd/Man City
programme.desc: A chance to relive some classic action from the Premier League. Here, a memorable Manchester derby at Old Trafford back in the 2011-12 season that saw a six-goal Man City run rampant.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games:Man U/Arsenal 01
programme.desc: A chance to relive some classic action from the Premier League. Here, Manchester United versus Arsenal back in the 2000-01 season in a one-sided game that saw seven goals.

programme.title: PL Greatest Games: L'pool/Newc 96
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the Premier League. Here, rewind to the seven-goal thriller between Liverpool and Newcastle United at Anfield back in the 1995-96 season.

programme.title: US Open '24: Draper v Zhang
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper takes to the court for a first-round encounter with 27-year-old Zhizhen Zhang of China at the 2024 US Open.

programme.title: US Open '24: Draper v Diaz
programme.desc: Jack Draper's US Open adventure continues with a second-round clash against Argentine Facundo Diaz Acosta. Draper's campaign began with victory in round one over Zhizhen Zhang.

programme.title: EFL 16/17: Sheff Weds v Sheff Utd
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, relive a thrilling Steel City derby between rivals Sheffield Wednesday and Sheffield United at Hillsborough Stadium.

programme.title: EFL 16/17: Leeds Utd v Sheff Utd
programme.desc: A look at a classic match from the EFL. Here, Leeds and Sheffield United go head-to-head at Elland Road in a thrilling contest back in 2017.

programme.title: EFL 16/17: Ipswich v Sheff Weds
programme.desc: A look at a classic match from the EFL. Here, Ipswich Town and Sheffield Wednesday meet at Portman Road in a four-goal thriller back in 2017.

programme.title: EFL 16/17: QPR v Brentford
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, QPR and Brentford go head-to-head at Loftus Road in a west London derby in 2017 that had a dramatic finish.

programme.title: BMW International 2023 Hlts
programme.desc: The fourth and final day of the 2023 BMW International Open, taking place in Germany at the Golfclub Munchen Eichenried. Li Haotong prevailed here last year. (25.06)

programme.title: Women's Irish Open 2024 Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the KPMG Women's Irish Open, held at Carton House's O'Meara Course in Dublin. The 2023 tournament was won by Smilla Tarning Soenderby from Denmark.

programme.title: EFL 16/17:Sheff Utd v Bristol City
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, Sheffield United host Bristol City at Bramall Lane in 2017 in a game with a late dramatic twist.

programme.title: EFL 16/17: Reading v Cardiff
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, Reading host Cardiff City at the Madejski Stadium in 2017 in a game with a thrilling conclusion.

programme.title: EFL 17/18: Bristol City v Man Utd
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL Cup. Here, Bristol City host Premier League Man Utd at Ashton Gate in the 2017-18 competition's quarter-finals.

programme.title: EFL 17/18: Leeds v Bristol City
programme.desc: A chance to relive a classic match from the EFL. Here, Leeds United host Bristol City at Elland Road in the Sky Bet Championship in a match that saw a dramatic comeback.

programme.title: US Open '24: Tiafoe v Shelton
programme.desc: In a rematch of last year's epic quarter-final meeting, countrymen Ben Shelton and Frances Tiafoe prepare to meet again as the Americans square off on Arthur Ashe at the US Open.

programme.title: 2nd Test Day 1: ENG v IND

programme.desc: Ipswich: Auction anarchy in the UK. Heavy D is doing what he does best and driving the others mad. Nat, Linda, Boudicca and Ione may have to team up to beat the Boominator!

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Kent: Sean Kelly keeps order in the volatile reality series that sees rival auction experts battle for unseen storage units. A double car lot is up for grabs in Broadstairs.

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: Guy Martin visits the most important place in the entire national grid, the central control room, where electricity is bought, sold and routed every single second of the day.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie, Chris and Paddy confront the male midlife crisis by buying the perfect sports cars for 'gentlemen of a certain age', and Chris tests out the raucous new Toyota GR Yaris hot hatch.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris, and Paddy McGuinness head to the British Grand Prix for a showdown with a trio of F1's finest drivers - also, Paddy pays tribute to Eddie Kidd OBE.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Food Pairings: Si and Dave explore how British ingredients can combine to make classic pairings. The duo create a pork and apple dish and a pear and stilton tart.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: Puglia and Corfu: In Corfu, Rick attends a family feast, visits the island's kitchens and learns how to make authentic Greek food.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Rhod Gilbert, Jamie Laing, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Claudia Winkleman.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock, the Reverend Richard Coles, broadcaster Stuart Maconie and comedian Lou Sanders test their general knowledge skills.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games

programme.title: QI XL

programme.desc: Independence Day. Rich and his team race to stay ahead of the helicopter drops. And, an eight-point earthquake leaves Creig's build on shaky ground. S4, Ep6

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Proving Day. Shawn's obsession with the bluff hits breaking point. Zeke and Emily take a last trip to Sledge Island, and novice George Young seeks riches on the Bering Sea floor. S6, Ep4

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Fickle Fortune. Halfway through the season, Shawn needs massive gold at the Bluff or his empire faces ruin. After the debacle at Sledge Island, Zeke and Emily reach breaking point. S6, Ep5

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: 450 Mile Storm. Sig, Johnathan and Jake try to escape a second arctic hurricane, but Keith refuses to heed warnings. Stress-induced chest pains threaten the rest of Sig's season. S13, Ep14

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Respect Earned. After suffering chest pains, Sig awaits news in the hospital. Wild Bill pilots the Summer Bay whilst handling conflict on deck, and Sean lays down the law with Zack. S13, Ep15

programme.title: Building Alaska
programme.desc: Gotta Be Efficient. Jackie's team hears propane leaking in their cabin as they install the cabinets and stove. And, a chimney installation is not going as planned for the Hills team. S10, Ep7

programme.title: Building Off The Grid
programme.desc: Maine Straw Bale Cabin. An eco-friendly couple are battling against the harsh winter weather to build a timber and straw-bale cabin in Maine. They are building in a heavily wooded forest. S1, Ep4

programme.title: Building Off The Grid
programme.desc: Vermont Stone House. A novice builder tries to construct a stone cabin in Vermont's White River Valley but his inexperience and the harsh winter push him to his limits. S1, Ep7

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Homestead Haul. For the first time since blasting Kilcher Road, Eivin tries to haul a huge pole barn to his homestead. Jewel and her son visit, and August builds a unique outhouse. S9, Ep10

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Tangled In The Tide. Eivin and Atz Sr. get tangled as the tide comes in. Atz Lee and Jane teach the next generation of Kilchers to fish. Otto and Charlotte give Eve an amazing gift. S9, Ep11

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Paradise In Peril. In Hawaii, the Raneys rescue a young family with a crumbling cabin on a homestead infested by slugs carrying a brain-eating parasite. S4, Ep5

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Misfits put their faith in an ancient bulldozer for the season's last dig. Meanwhile, infighting stalls efforts to unearth the Opal Whisperers' haul. S5, Ep19

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen risk their lives digging where opal thieves removed the ceiling supports. Meanwhile, the Blacklighters switch to dangerous night mining. S5, Ep20

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: We Have Not Yet Begun to Fight. As the polar ice descends, The Saga is in danger of sinking, Jake must act fast to save his crew, and Josh gambles big-time by heading towards danger. S11, Ep18

programme.title: Expedition X
programme.desc: Avalanche Ghost Train. At the site of America's deadliest avalanche, witnesses report bizarre apparitions and feelings of dread. Phil and Jess test a mind-bending scientific theory. S3, Ep8

programme.title: Expedition Unknown
programme.desc: Hunt For Our Ancient Ancestors. Josh Gates travels the globe to unravel the mystery of humanity's origins. How did we survive to the modern day, and what does it mean for our future? S6, Ep7

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Vegas: The adults are Vegas-bound when Jay hooks them up with Excelsior Level hotel accommodation, courtesy of one of his big clients.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Conjugal Conjecture: The gang face an awkward morning after Sheldon's mother and Leonard's father share an evening together. Penny's family arrive in town.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Military Miniaturization: Howard has a meeting with Air Force representative Colonel Williams about the gyroscope he invented with Leonard and Sheldon.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Dependence Transcendence: Tensions rise when the guys struggle to complete their Air Force project on time and are forced to work around the clock.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Launch Party and a Whole Human Being: The Coopers can't be found as Mandy goes into labour, and Sheldon is excited about the launch of his database.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Teen Angst and a Smart-Boy Walk of Shame: Sheldon confronts the failure of his database, Georgie and Mandy struggle as new parents, and Missy feels forgotten.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Blindsided: The Dunphys and Pritchetts go head-to-head when Luke decides his best chance of getting into college is to run against Manny in the senior class president election.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Weathering Heights: Phil's excited when he's invited on the local news. And his day gets even better when he meets his weatherman hero, Rainer Shine (guest star Nathan Fillion).

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Barting Over: Bart moves into a downtown apartment of his own, and befriends famous skateboarder Tony Hawk (guest starring as himself). Also guest starring Blink-182.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: I'm Spelling as Fast as I Can: Lisa wins a place at the Spellympics National Spelling Bee but discovers that it's not as clean-cut a competition as she thought.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Allowance Evaporation: Amy is furious when she learns that Sheldon has shared intimate details of their relationship with his colleagues.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Comic-Con Conundrum: Cut off from his father's fortune, Raj appoints Sheldon to organise his finances. Penny considers joining the guys at Comic-Con.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Escape Hatch Identification: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldon's old room to Raj when he's forced to move out of his flat, leading to unexpected conflict.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Treehouse of Horror XVI: Bart falls into a coma and is replaced by a well-behaved robot. Homer takes part in a deadly TV game show. And Lisa turns into Albert Einstein.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Grace wakes from her coma with a shocking revelation. Tony hosts a wine-tasting at The Hutch, where Marie senses a secret in the room... And someone's about to be exposed.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Twisted World of Marge Simpson: Marge opens a pretzel franchise after meeting the Pretzel Man (guest star Jack Lemmon). But Fat Tony wants a slice of the action.

programme.title: New: Below Deck Mediterranean
programme.desc: Brand new series - Fourth Stew's a Charm: There's tension when the stew dynamic is shaken up even more. Two deckhands have a heated confrontation, and flirting widens the divide.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the box this time, The Traitors, I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!, Michael McIntyre's The Wheel, Planet Sex with Cara Delevingne and You Won't Believe This.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The series starts with Starstruck, The Piano, You, Rick Stein's Cornwall, Stacey Dooley Sleeps Over USA, This Morning (world's longest tongue), and ITV News (cheese).

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Neuroscientist and self-confessed geek Michael is yet to find someone with the right kind of chemistry. His date Hannah hopes that her dream man exists outside her romance novels.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Middle Earth Paradigm: Penny's Halloween party puts Leonard, Sheldon, Howard and Raj through a demanding new test of their social skills.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Dumpling Paradox: When Howard seduces Penny's friend and spends the night with her in Penny's flat, Penny asks if she can sleep on Leonard and Sheldon's sofa.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Mr Santiago: Peralta goes to extremes to impress Santiago's dad at Thanksgiving dinner. Holt helps Pimento deal with no longer being able to work for the NYPD.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Skyfire Cycle: When a famous author receives death threats, Peralta and Jeffords take the case so that Jeffords can meet his lifelong literary hero.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: The Goldbergs' Excellent Adventure: In the first episode of season nine, the family look for a way to honour Pops' memory.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Horse Play: As Beverly disrupts Adam's college admission plans, Erica discovers that her future father-in-law blames her for a prank she didn't pull.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Vegas: The adults are Vegas-bound when Jay hooks them up with Excelsior Level hotel accommodation, courtesy of one of his big clients.

programme.title: Below Deck Mediterranean
programme.desc: Brand new series - Fourth Stew's a Charm: There's tension when the stew dynamic is shaken up even more. Two deckhands have a heated confrontation, and flirting widens the divide.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Capri: In Eagle Rock, California, Gordon helps Capri, a restaurant in a rut that's owned by identical twins Jim and Jeff and is closed more often than it's open.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Riptide Waters: Barry and Adam join forces to save a water park that's being threatened with closure. Wedding planning opens a rift between Beverly and Erica.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Mr Santiago: Peralta goes to extremes to impress Santiago's dad at Thanksgiving dinner. Holt helps Pimento deal with no longer being able to work for the NYPD.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Wedding, Part 1: Mitch and Cam's big day arrives and nothing can ruin it - until nothing turns into a whole lot of somethings and puts wedding planner Pepper to the test.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Wedding, Part 2: Wedding day chaos continues as the party shifts from one contingency plan to another. Guests start getting testy, and Mitchell and Cameron become discouraged.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip featuring animals and food, from the always hilarious Tube that is Rude.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The Burger Kitchen Part 1: In the first half of a two-part Nightmare, Gordon tries to save a burger joint in LA, run by a dysfunctional family in a state of constant conflict.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The Burger Kitchen Part 2: In the second half of a two-part Nightmare in LA, can Gordon Ramsay bring together the fragmented Saffron family and save their failing restaurant?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: How I Spent My Strummer Vacation: Homer goes to a rock 'n' roll camp. When it's time to leave, he just wants to keep rockin' with Mick Jagger, Keith Richards and Lenny Kravitz.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart vs. Lisa vs. the Third Grade: Bart is held back a year at school and Lisa is moved up into the same class as him.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: An Ugly Car, an Affair and Some Kickass Football: George Sr is asked to help with the football team. Mandy finds out about Georgie and Meemaw's secret business.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Tougher Nut and a Note on File: Sheldon's search for a comic leads to a breakthrough. Georgie and Mandy have an uncomfortable first encounter with her parents.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Cover-Up: Phil has a new client who is also 'his type'. Afraid that might get him into trouble with Claire, he tells some seemingly innocent lies, which lead to more lies...

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Express Yourself: Phil has the crazy idea of going on a spontaneous trip to Paris with Claire. And Jay takes over their bathroom renovation.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A Hard Jay's Night: Mitch struggles to hide his true feelings about the unflattering wedding topper that Cam's father whittled out of soap for them.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cohabitation Experimentation: When Amy's flat is flooded, she has to move out while it is being repaired and proposes a 'cohabitation experiment' with Sheldon.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Hot Tub Contamination: Leonard and Penny intervene when Sheldon and Amy have an argument. Howard and Bernadette are disturbed by unexpected guests.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Fetal Kick Catalyst: Penny meets her fans at a comic book convention. Sheldon and Amy host brunch at Penny's flat. Howard makes an impulsive purchase.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Stolen Truck and Going on the Lam: Missy steals her dad's truck and hits the road with her friend Paige.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A German Folk Song and an Actual Adult: Georgie goes on a birthday date, and Sheldon takes an interest in Missy's favourite TV show.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Halloween 4: The Revenge of Rod Skyhook: Luke's Halloween party looks bad. The Dunphys decide it needs is a visit from Rod Skyhook, a little promotion and some adult supervision...

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Grab It!: Jay's favourite place in the world may be losing some of its charm when Phil considers becoming a member. And Claire mistakes her influence on Alex's life choices.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A Star Is Born Again: A famous and sultry movie star (guest star Marisa Tomei) swoops into town with eyes for none other than Ned Flanders, making him the envy of Springfield.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Spritz Goes to Washington: Krusty wreaks havoc on the political system after the Simpsons help him to get elected.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Collaboration Fluctuation: Leonard, Penny and Raj settle into their new living arrangement, and Sheldon expresses an interest in Amy's professional life.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Recollection Dissipation: Sheldon collaborates on two projects - one with Leonard and Howard, plus another with Amy - pushing himself to the limit.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Separation Agitation: Howard and Bernadette are upset when they leave Halley at the nursery. Bert the geologist introduces his girlfriend to the gang.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge's Son Poisoning: Bart gets picked on at school for riding a tandem with Marge.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Pray Anything: Jealous of Flanders' lifestyle, Homer starts to pray for material possessions, but things get out of hand when he asks for a bigger house and gets the church.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In Marge We Trust: Homer discovers that a Japanese dishwashing powder company is using his face as its logo. And Marge dishes out advice to the church's parishioners.

programme.title: New: Below Deck Mediterranean
programme.desc: Brand new series - Chain of Command-ment: The crew head into their final charter determined to finish strong. A relationship heats up, and drama peaks when Aesha calls out a stew.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the box this time: Coronation Street, Love Island, Sex Actually with Alice Levine, Starstruck, Cheat, Dancing on Ice, and Catfish UK.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Romcom fanatic Becky meets blue-eyed chef Leigh, but is he more interested in the Manchester United score than their date?

programme.title: Moonfall
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi disaster with Halle Berry. A NASA bigwig, a disgraced astronaut and a conspiracy theorist are all that stand between the Earth and a plummeting Moon. But are aliens involved?

programme.title: True History of the Kelly Gang
programme.desc: (2019) Intense fictional account of 19th-century bushman Ned Kelly's (George MacKay) journey into crime and life on the run. With Russell Crowe. Very strong language/violence throughout.

programme.title: Utama
programme.desc: (2022) Poignant drama about a couple being driven out from their lifelong home in the mountain plateaus of Bolivia by drought. In Quechua/Spanish, subs. Upestting scenes.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: (1950) Western. John Wayne plays the commander of a Texan fort at which his ex-wife (Maureen O'Hara) pitches up. Can he win back her love by saving kidnapped children from Apache raiders?

programme.title: The Man Between
programme.desc: (1953) Atmospheric thriller set in post-war Berlin, where Ivo Kern (James Mason) and Susanne Mallison (Claire Bloom) get caught up in a maelstrom of bigamy, blackmail and bullets.

programme.title: Two Way Stretch
programme.desc: (1960) Comedy. Peter Sellers, Bernard Cribbins and David Lodge star as criminals happily incarcerated in a prison run like a home-from-home for old lags and rascals by a liberal governor.

programme.title: The Land that Time Forgot
programme.desc: (1974) Fantasy adventure about survivors from a torpedoed First World War ship who end up in a legendary land in the Atlantic where dinosaurs roam. With Doug McClure.

programme.title: The Madness of King George
programme.desc: (1994) Oscar-winning drama with Nigel Hawthorne and Ian Holm. In 1788, King George III starts exhibiting signs of mental illness and is forced to endure barbaric 'cures'.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost...
programme.desc: ...Protocol: (2011) Part four of the Tom Cruise action-thriller franchise. The Impossible Missions Force fight to clear their name, while also trying to avert nuclear war. Busy, busy, busy!

programme.title: American Refugee
programme.desc: (2021) Tense survival thriller that opens with news of the American economy tanking, oil prices plummeting, supply chains being disrupted and borders closing causing people to panic...

programme.title: Another Round
programme.desc: (2020) Oscar-winning drama. Four schoolteachers decide to test the theory that humans are born with 0.05% too little alcohol in the blood. Strong language/sex/drugs. In Danish/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Ten Tall Men
programme.desc: (1951) Comedy adventure. Burt Lancaster stars as a Foreign Legion sergeant leading nine men on a dangerous mission to prevent a Berber attack on a North African desert fort.

programme.title: The Moonraker
programme.desc: (1958) Romantic thriller. George Baker stars as a heroic Cavalier horseman, beating off the Roundhead foe as he single-handedly smuggles the country's aristocracy to safety in France.

programme.title: 13 Rue Madeleine
programme.desc: (1947) WWII drama. James Cagney stars as the tough US secret agent overseeing a special mission to discover the location of the factory where the Nazis are manufacturing their flying bombs.

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: (2004) Quirky high-school comedy starring Jon Heder as a nerdy teenager from an eccentric family, who gains a new-found respect when he organises his friend's student election campaign.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: (2010) Remake of the classic martial arts film, starring Jackie Chan and Jaden Smith. A caretaker shows an American boy how to stand up to bullies at his new school in Beijing.

programme.title: Plane
programme.desc: (2023) Action thriller starring Gerard Butler as an airline pilot who must become a one-man army after crashlanding on an island overrun by bad guys. To survive, he's gonna have to wing it.

programme.title: Friends with Benefits
programme.desc: (2011) Romcom. Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis star as friends who aren't fans of romance. But they do like sex. Can they really sleep together but avoid all that emotion?

programme.title: Blue Juice
programme.desc: (1994) Ewan McGregor, Sean Pertwee and Catherine Zeta-Jones star in this fast-paced comedy drama set in the Cornish surfing community. A veteran surfer's heart is torn between love and sea.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Cover Girl
programme.desc: (1944) Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly star in Charles Vidor's Technicolor comedy musical about a chorus girl's rise to fame. Featuring songs and a score from Jerome Kern and Ira Gershwin.

programme.title: El Dorado
programme.desc: (1966) John Wayne and Robert Mitchum star in Howard Hawks's western. In El Dorado, a gunfighter and a sheriff help protect a rancher from a rival landowner.

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: (1993) Anthony Hopkins stars in this subtle drama about the dedicated butler of a post-WWI home whose loyalties are tested when the housekeeper (Emma Thompson) falls in love with him.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody Interview...
programme.desc: ...Special: Oscar-winning actor Rami Malek discusses playing Freddie Mercury in the rock biopic about the rise of the band Queen.

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: (2016) Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer and Janelle Monáe star in the Oscar-nominated, fact-based drama about three women whose genius made a significant contribution to the space race.

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: (2022) It's Predator, 1719 style. Amber Midthunder stars as a Comanche hunter who must save her tribe from an extraterrestrial threat in this action prequel. If it bleeds, you can kill it.

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: (1987) Sci-fi thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. A US commando unit gets trapped in the jungle by a murderous, seemingly invincible alien hunter. But they ain't got time to bleed.

programme.title: Patrick Christys Tonight
programme.desc: Join Patrick for two hours of spirited debate and news making interviews. Top guests tackle the issues that matter, with a sharp take on every story.

programme.title: Patrick Christys Tonight Late...
programme.desc: Edition. Tomorrow's news, tonight. All the major stories making the front pages and full coverage of all the breaking news at home and abroad with Patrick Christys.

programme.title: Farage
programme.desc: Nigel Farage doesn't hold back in his GB News prime-time show. Hear his views and give your own in an hour of discussion and debate. Join Nigel as he takes on the big stories other media won't touch.

programme.title: Jacob Rees-Mogg's State Of The Nation Replay
programme.desc: Join Jacob for his unique and unmissable take on the day's news.

programme.title: Patrick Christys Tonight Late...
programme.desc: Edition. Tomorrow's news, tonight. All the major stories making the front pages and full coverage of all the breaking news at home and abroad with Patrick Christys.

programme.title: Patrick Christys Tonight
programme.desc: Join Patrick for two hours of spirited debate and news making interviews. Top guests tackle the issues that matter, with a sharp take on every story.

programme.title: Patrick Christys Tonight Late...
programme.desc: Edition. Tomorrow's news, tonight. All the major stories making the front pages and full coverage of all the breaking news at home and abroad with Patrick Christys.

programme.title: Breakfast with Eamonn and Ellie
programme.desc: Join Eamonn Holmes & Ellie Costello to start your day across the United Kingdom. This is your breakfast show. Join the conversation about what is happening in our nation and the world.

programme.title: Britain's Newsroom
programme.desc: Andrew and Bev present every weekday morning. When the news happens, it happens here. But what does it mean for you? GB News brings you the biggest stories and the answers you need from across the UK.

programme.title: Good Afternoon Britain

programme.desc: No Country Club for Old Men: Subversive animated comedy. The Griffins are invited to join the prestigious Barrington Country Club, but get thrown out.

programme.desc: NSA (No Snoops Allowed): Animated series. Steve is approached by the NSA, who convince him to help them spy on Stan. Roger convinces Hayley to resume being a carnivore once a year.

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Holy S***, Jeff's Back!: Animated series. Everyone is surprised when Jeff suddenly shows up at the Smith household, but it soon becomes clear that he is an alien impostor.

programme.title: Bob's Burgers
programme.desc: The Amazing Rudy: Animated comedy. Bob and Linda get a chance to see how kind Louise can be when an embarrassed Rudy runs away from a monthly dinner with his divorced parents.

programme.title: Plebs
programme.desc: The Baby: Sitcom set in ancient Rome. When Grumio finds a baby behind some bins and brings it home, Stylax uses the infant to strike up a relationship with an attractive wet nurse.

programme.desc: Oh Mighty Gay One: Comedy-drama series. When Ted is paired with 14-year-old Albie in a school mentoring scheme, the issue of Albie's struggles with anorexia becomes apparent to him.

programme.desc: Matt Edmondson narrates a funny selection of Guinness World Record attempts, this time featuring the most hair rollers put on in one minute while on a rollercoaster.

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: .The suspects return home and attempt to patch their lives back together, while a surprising connection is revealed. Katherine Newman finds her chances of becoming the US ambassador under threat, and a scapegoat is urgently required to defuse the growing scandal. Psychological thriller, starring Kunal Nayyar, Georgina Campbell, Elyes Gabel, Elizabeth Henstridge and Angel Coulby

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Dermot O'Leary's Taste of Ireland
programme.desc: Dermot heads to cosmopolitan Cork, a port city renowned for its food and produce. Dermot's begins his culinary adventure at the curiously named English Market, where he samples cheese and spiced beef, a kind of pastrami unique to the city

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: We're joined by Rachel De Souza as the Children's Commissioner says children in England are now facing near 'Dickensian' levels of poverty, including no heating and no breakfast.

programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James serves up the ultimate ham sandwich, enjoys a delicious Spanish recipe for turbot from chef Jose Pizarro, shows how to make a classic sole meunière in another masterclass. He also treats singer Gabrielle to a Thai green curry that he makes with a little help from chefs Richard Corrigan and Nick Nairn

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Married Londoners Pete and Matt, Hertfordshire mother and daughter Debbie and Taylor, and new parents Charly and Marcus from Essex use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Joe is hit hard by an assailant, Charity worries for a fragile Sarah, and Kim braces herself to tell Dawn that she has got a new man.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. Gathering at Hulton Manor, a sprawling edifice on its own island, a storm rages outside adding to the immersive experience of the fictional murder playing out in front of them, until one of them tumbles down the stairs, and is impaled by a life-size Egyptian figure - killing him for real

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Sarah was left in the stairwell of a Surrey car park in 2001. She is the youngest foundling to appear on the show. Also looking for answers is Chris who, at three months old, was dropped off at a childminder's near Kings Cross in London, 62 years ago. He still needs to know who his birth family is and why nobody ever returned to pick him up. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell host

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the fourth stage, a hilly 174.2km route between Amiens and Rouen. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Jacopo Guarnieri, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Jeremy Pang's Hong Kong Kitchen
programme.desc: Jeremy is joined by good friend and food critic Grace Dent as they kick off a culinary adventure with a cocktail that is infused with beef dripping before they head to one of Hong Kong's finest restaurants. Jeremy then arranges a journey to Kuk Po, one of Hong Kong's last traditional villages, where he and Grace feast on true local cuisine

programme.title: Gary Barlow's Food and Wine Tour: Australia
programme.desc: Gary ends his tour in northern Queensland, and is joined by his daughter Emily and her boyfriend Marshall. programme.title: ITV Evening News

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v Wales (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from the second Group D match for both teams, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. The teams made contrasting starts to their tournament, with France claiming a 2-1 win over holders' England, and Wales holding firm for nearly half the match in their finals debut against the Netherlands, but eventually succumbing to a 3-0 defeat. The last matches between the sides came in qualifying for the 2023 FIFA World Cup, and saw France win 2-0 at home and 2-1 away. They will be favourites to prevail once again, but Rhian Wilkinson's team will be again expected to make things difficult for them as they chase what would be a famous victory

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.desc: Action from the fifth stage, a 33km individual time-trial around Caen in Normandy. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Jacopo Guarnieri, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: The Assembly: Unseen
programme.desc: Out-takes and unseen questions from David Tennant, Gary Lineker, Danny Dyer and Jade Thirlwall's interviews with an audience of neurodivergent individuals. Including Danny Dyer's take on Andrew Tate, Jade Thirlwall's crush on Paul Hollywood, David Tennant's sex scene injury and Gary Lineker's stance on working in countries with chequered human rights records

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the sixth stage, a hilly 201.5km route from Bayeux to Vire in Normandy. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Jacopo Guarnieri and Alex Dowsett, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: TikTok: Murder Gone Viral
programme.desc: A look at the case of American influencer Alexis Sharkey, who was declared missing in November 2020 by her husband Thomas Sharkey. When her body was found on a side road by a truck driver shortly after, detectives began an investigation that led to her spouse. However, just two weeks after the body was found, he also disappeared without trace

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025
programme.desc: France v Wales (Kick-off 8.00pm). Laura Woods presents all the action from the second Group D match for both teams, held at Arena St Gallen in Switzerland. The teams made contrasting starts to their tournament, with France claiming a 2-1 win over holders' England, and Wales holding firm for nearly half the match in their finals debut against the Netherlands, but eventually succumbing to a 3-0 defeat. The last matches between the sides came in qualifying for the 2023 FIFA World Cup, and saw France win 2-0 at home and 2-1 away. They will be favourites to prevail once again, but Rhian Wilkinson's team will be again expected to make things difficult for them as they chase what would be a famous victory
